OPSEC: Because Jail is for wuftpd 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9XaYdCdwiWU

Tor works you can also own cable modems to get unprovisioned access to a ISP network

This is old and alot of ISPs use BPI+ in a forced state so you will have to do some digging.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tEg09zSsfQo

Cellular networks also can be useful since some cannot not issue static internal IP's and 
have one main gateway out of there ISP lan can prob used a prepaid service along with 
TOR.

Good way is to pay for anonymous VPN service using XMR.

Then connect to it using TOR as a proxy so that the VPN provider only sees the exit node IP 
and the exit node only sees encrypted VPN traffic.
